field.name: id
field.comment: Unique CiviCRM FundraisingPage ID (Mapped to reference)

field.name: charity_id
field.title: Charity ID
field.comment: The charityId argument specifies the charity to create the fundraising page for. (Required)

field.name: event_id
field.title: Event ID
field.comment: The eventId argument specifies the event to create the fundraising page for. This argument must be omitted if an activityType is specified.

field.name: page_short_name
field.title: Page Short Name
field.comment: The pageShortName argument specifies the url you want to assign the new fundraising page. If the short url is available your page will be available at http://www.justgiving.com/{pageShortName} once it is created. (Required)

field.name: page_title
field.title: Page Title
field.comment: The pageTitle argument allows you to provide a title for the page. (Required)

field.name: activity_type
field.title: Activity Type
field.comment: The activityType argument specifies the type of activity the page is for. This argument must be omitted if an eventId is specified. ActivityTypes: Birthday Wedding OtherCelebration InMemory

field.name: target_amount
field.title: Target Amount
field.comment: The targetAmount argument allows you to specify a target amount to raise. (Optional)

field.name: charity_opt_in
field.title: Charity Opt-in
field.comment: The charityOptIn argument allows you to indicate whether the user wishes to opt in to receive communications from the charity the fundraising page is for. (Required)

field.name: event_date
field.title: Event Date
field.comment: The eventDate argument allows you to specify when the event will take place. Required for event activity types (i.e: Birthday, Wedding, OtherCelebration, InMemory).

field.name: event_date
field.title: Event Date
field.comment: The eventDate argument allows you to specify when the event will take place. Required for event activity types (i.e: Birthday, Wedding, OtherCelebration, InMemory).

field.name: event_name
field.title: Event Name
field.comment: The eventName argument allows you to specify a name for the event. Required for event activity types (i.e: Birthday, Wedding, OtherCelebration, InMemory).

field.name: event_name
field.title: Event Name
field.comment: The eventName argument allows you to specify a name for the event. Required for event activity types (i.e: Birthday, Wedding, OtherCelebration, InMemory).

field.name: attribution
field.title: Attribution
field.comment: The attribution argument allows you to specify who the fundraising page is attributed to. Required for occasion, organised event and in-memory activity types (i.e: all except Birthday, Wedding).

field.name: charity_funded
field.title: Charity Funded
field.comment: The charityFunded argument specifies whether the charity is contributing in some way to the fundraising, which can affect Gift Aid. For more information about how Gift Aid works http://bit.ly/cZfY1R (Required)

field.name: cause_id
field.title: Cause ID
field.comment: The causeId argument specifies the cause you are creating a fundraising page for. (Optional)

field.name: company_appeal_id
field.title: Company Appeal ID
field.comment: The companyAppealId argument specifies the company appeal you are creating a fundraising page for. (Optional)

field.name: expiry_date
field.title: Expiry Date
field.comment: The date the page should expire. This is ignored if you are creating a fundraising page for a pre-defined event.

field.name: page_story
field.title: pageStory
field.comment: The Page Story.

field.name: page_summary_what
field.title: pageSummaryWhat
field.comment: The 'I'm doing action X' part of the fundraising page summary. (Optional). 50 characters max.

field.name: page_summary_why
field.title: pageSummaryWhy
field.comment: The 'reason Z' part of the fundraising page summary. (Optional). 50 characters max.

field.name: team_id
field.title: teamId
field.comment: The teamId argument specifies the team to which the fundraising page will be associated with.

field.name: currency
field.title: currency
field.comment: Must be a valid ISO currency code. Will default to GBP if omitted. For a list of valid codes, use the Currency API.
